about.summary: The first stand-alone R package for computation of latent correlation that takes into account all variable types (continuous/binary/ordinal/zero-inflated), comes with an optimized memory footprint, and is computationally efficient, essentially making latent correlation estimation almost as fast as rank-based correlation estimation. The estimation is based on latent copula Gaussian models. For continuous/binary types, see Fan, J., Liu, H., Ning, Y., and Zou, H. (2017). For ternary type, see Quan X., Booth J.G. and Wells M.T. (2018) <arXiv:1809.06255>. For truncated type or zero-inflated type, see Yoon G., Carroll R.J. and Gaynanova I. (2020) <doi:10.1093/biomet/asaa007>. For approximation method of computation, see Yoon G., Müller C.L. and Gaynanova I. (2021) <doi:10.1080/10618600.2021.1882468>. The latter method uses multi-linear interpolation originally implemented in the R package <https://cran.r-project.org/package=chebpol>.

For approximation method of computation, see Yoon G., Müller C.L. and Gaynanova I. (2021) <doi:10.1080/10618600.2021.1882468>. The latter method uses multi-linear interpolation originally implemented in the R package <https://cran.r-project.org/package=chebpol>.

name: r-latentcor

about.summary: The first stand-alone R package for computation of latent correlation that takes into account all variable types (continuous/binary/ordinal/zero-inflated), comes with an optimized memory footprint, and is computationally efficient, essentially making latent correlation estimation almost as fast as rank-based correlation estimation. The estimation is based on latent copula Gaussian models. For continuous/binary types, see Fan, J., Liu, H., Ning, Y., and Zou, H. (2017). For ternary type, see Quan X., Booth J.G. and Wells M.T. (2018) <arXiv:1809.06255>. For truncated type or zero-inflated type, see Yoon G., Carroll R.J. and Gaynanova I. (2020) <doi:10.1093/biomet/asaa007>. For approximation method of computation, see Yoon G., Müller C.L. and Gaynanova I. (2021) <doi:10.1080/10618600.2021.1882468>. The latter method uses multi-linear interpolation originally implemented in the R package <https://cran.r-project.org/package=chebpol>.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '2.0.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-latentcor
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/latentcor_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/latentcor/latentcor_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 20cbc7aaf5cf7fd550474149785b557d03a4768198594196d13fad8e9b7c1e31

build:
  number: 3
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-matrix
    - r-dofuture
    - r-dorng
    - r-fmultivar
    - r-foreach
    - r-future
    - r-geometry
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-heatmaply
    - r-microbenchmark
    - r-mnormt
    - r-pcapp
    - r-plotly
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-matrix
    - r-dofuture
    - r-dorng
    - r-fmultivar
    - r-foreach
    - r-future
    - r-geometry
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-heatmaply
    - r-microbenchmark
    - r-mnormt
    - r-pcapp
    - r-plotly

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('latentcor')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('latentcor')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=latentcor
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: "The first stand-alone R package for computation of latent correlation that takes
    into account all variable types (continuous/binary/ordinal/zero-inflated), comes
    with an optimized memory footprint, and is computationally efficient, essentially
    making latent correlation estimation almost as fast as rank-based correlation estimation.
    The estimation is based on latent copula Gaussian models. For continuous/binary
    types, see Fan, J., Liu, H., Ning, Y., and Zou, H. (2017). For ternary type, see
    Quan X., Booth J.G. and Wells M.T. (2018) <arXiv:1809.06255>. For truncated type
    or zero-inflated type, see Yoon G., Carroll R.J. and Gaynanova I. (2020) <doi:10.1093/biomet/asaa007>.
    For approximation method of computation, see Yoon G., M\xFCller C.L. and Gaynanova
    I. (2021) <doi:10.1080/10618600.2021.1882468>. The latter method uses multi-linear
    interpolation originally implemented in the R package <https://cran.r-project.org/package=chebpol>."
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

The estimation is based on latent copula Gaussian models. For continuous/binary types, see Fan, J., Liu, H., Ning, Y., and Zou, H. (2017). For ternary type, see Quan X., Booth J.G. and Wells M.T.
